contentrichtext.text: Five ships of the [[Royal Navy]] have been named '''HMS ''Odin''''' after the god [[Odin]] in [[Norse mythology]]. A sixth was ordered, but later cancelled: *{{HMS|Odin|1807|6}} was a 74-gun [[third rate]] captured from the Danish at the [[Battle of Copenhagen (1807)|Battle of Copenhagen]] in 1807. She was used for harbour service from 1811 and was sold in 1825. *{{HMS|Odin|1846|6}} was a [[Paddle steamer|paddle]] steam frigate launched in 1846 sold in 1865. *{{HMS|Odin|1901|6}} was a sloop launched in 1901 and sold in 1920. Delivered the [[Somali people|Somali]] Sultan [[Mohamoud Ali Shire]] to the [[Seychelles]] in 1920, where he was sentenced to exile. *{{HMS|Odin|N84|6}} was an [[Odin class submarine|''Odin'' class]] [[submarine]] launched in 1928. She was sunk by Italian ships in 1940. *HMS ''Odin'' was to have been an [[Algerine class minesweeper|''Algerine''-class]] [[minesweeper (ship)|minesweeper]] but she was cancelled in 1944. *{{HMS|Odin|S10|6}} was an [[Oberon class submarine|''Oberon''-class]] submarine launched in 1960 and scrapped in 1991. {{Shipindex}} {{Italic title prefixed|3}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Odin, Hms}} [[Category:Royal Navy ship names]]
